'''Naomi Klein''', Canadian journalist, author and activist, was born in [[Montreal]], [[Canada]] in [[1970]].
She is the author of ''[[No Logo]]'' ([[2000]]), which is to a certain extent a [[manifesto]] of the [[anti-globalization movement]]. And the soon-to-be-published ''[[Fences and Windows]].'' She also writes for [[Canada]]'s ''[[The Globe and Mail]]'' and ''[[The Guardian]]'' in Britain.
Her book ''[[No Logo]]'' was one of the first publications to recieve feedback from [[Nike]], a company she oft-criticises throughout the book.
